feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 8:25AM AKST until November 17 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts near Kenai and Nikiski. Winds gusting to 30 mph along the coast. Visibility reduced to one half mile at times. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula, mainly north of Ninilchik.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 17 at 8:25AM AKST until November 19 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Saturday night.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 8:05AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BANDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS FROM ANCHORAGE TO BIRD POINT FOR THE FRIDAY MORNING COMMUTE... Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers moving south across the Anchorage Bowl this morning will continue through 10 AM Friday morning. Expect snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour and visibilities reduced to as low as one half mile in these bands.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued November 17 at 8:03AM AKST until November 19 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Ward Lake near Areas Near The Ward Lake Recreational Area. * WHEN...Until 800 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 4:31AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Light Snow This Morning... Snow has fallen overnight with just over an inch in many areas. Light snow will continue this morning and then taper off to flurries this afternoon. Most areas can expect expect a storm total of 2 inches by noon today, with little additional accumulation after noon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 4:13AM AKST until November 17 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with reduced visibility. Additional snow accumulations of one to 2 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. North winds gusting to 40 mph. * WHERE...Central Brooks Range in Atigun Pass.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 6:12PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FALLING TEMPERATURES CREATING ICY ROAD CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT... Temperatures will fall below freezing tonight and continue to fall into the teens and 20s by Friday morning. This will allow the development of black ice to form on wet roadways and other hard surfaces. Any standing water or slushy conditions will also quickly refreeze overnight. If travelling, be prepared for rapid

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 17 at 10:34AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor has reached Moderate Flood stage (3.0 feet) due to recent heavy rain and northerly winds over the basin. A gradual decrease in the river level is forecast into the weekend but will remain above flood stage for the foreseeable future.

entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR EAST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... .Large and rough surf associated with strong trades and a northeast swell will maintain hazardous conditions along east facing shores today. entry.summary: ...ISOLATED FLOODING WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE ACROSS PUERTO RICO AND THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS DURING THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK... entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued November 17 at 11:24AM EST until November 18 at 6:00PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH SATURDAY... .A cold front tracks across the area tonight, with little or no rain expected east of the mountains. Northwest winds will pick up Saturday morning at 10 to 20 mph, with gusts up to 30 mph possible. At the same time, humidity levels will drop by the afternoon into the 20 to 30 percent range.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 17 at 12:12PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ISOLATED FLOODING WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE ACROSS PUERTO RICO AND THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS DURING THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK... As the Potential Tropical Cyclone Twenty-Two moves northeast, a moist southerly wind flow will prevail across the local islands through early the next workweek.
